website_summaries.verdict: A captivating addition and subtraction board game that the whole family can enjoy. Simple mathematical challenges, humorous pitfalls, and curious swamp creatures keep kids coming back for more.
pros: Encourages kids to use and improve their math skills in order to navigate the game more fluidly
Up to four people can play at once, making it ideal for families
Competitive element spurs kids to try harder
Difficulty can easily be increased by swapping out the dice for 10- or 12-sided versions
cons: Some parents felt that a certain part of the game dragged out too long

customer_reviews.title: Amazing ruination of a previously awesome game.
customer_reviews.text: Ugh. The old version was great. They made a small change to the new version that makes the game very frustrating and almost guaranteed to go twice or three times as long as it should. There used to be 3 squares that would let you escape the "Endless Loop." Now there's one. Round and round and round and round and round and round and round and round you'll go, until dinner is burnt and the kids want to throw the gameboard. If you can get your hands on the older version do it. But don't buy the new one. USER TESTING folks.
customer_reviews.author: La Gialla

customer_reviews.title: Error in original printing of new version
customer_reviews.text: I’ve heard such great things about this game and I love the idea of the game. BUT they changed the number placement on the board of the new version and it makes the endless loop very very frustrating that we have to change the rules to the game. And now I’m seeing that they have corrected this error and the new boards with the new version the numbers in the endless loop now line up. How do I get a replacement board without the error???? (Also from reading other reviews I notice that other customers have the same complaint about the new version and it’s not just me.)
customer_reviews.author: kz8

customer_reviews.title: Definitely helped 6 year old!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this game a couple weeks ago for pur 6 year old son. He HATED math! He couldn't add or subtract whatsoever, even using fingers was a challenge for him. Fast forward 2 weeks... We've played this game AT HIS REQUEST (a miracle) about 5-6 times now & he has improved significantly! Tonight he was doing most of the adding and subtracting in his head, no fingers needed! We highly recommend this game!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Fun math!
customer_reviews.text: Great math game. I've got my 6 and 4y/o girls both into this game. The older one is able to do all of the math in her head now and the little one is getting there. They love it. As it's too easy now for the 6 year-old, I've bought some 10-sided dice and that's giving her a little more work. Granted, the infinite loop can get pretty frustrating, but you can always make your own rules to get out after a couple passes or something like that.
customer_reviews.author: Dr BSTop Contributor: Boxing

customer_reviews.title: My 4-year old does math now
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 4-year-old during school closure. At the beginning of quarantine she couldn’t recognize all of her numbers to ten and I was worried about her. Thanks to this game, now she can do addition within 12 and subtraction within 6, count to 12, and determine greater than or less than within 6. She asks to play every single day. She prefers Polly Pocket people to the included game pieces. I keep 12 candy hearts in the box for her to use as manipulatives. We don’t use the endless loop. My husband was shocked when he saw that our daughter can now do math.
customer_reviews.author: Zrr

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: Great game!! I was a little skeptical as one of the images of the game board seemed like it would end too quickly but it took us about 40 min to play with four players. There is a section called the Endless Loop in which you must get the exact sum to land on the Exit of the Endless Loop to make it out of there. Covers addition and subtraction up to 12 with dice numbers 0-6 Game pieces are really cute as well. Would recommend for ages 4-8 for educational purposes
customer_reviews.author: Wv Mama

customer_reviews.title: Way cool way to practice math!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 and 5 year old grandkids love this game. I'm happy they are using "subtraction" as well as "addition" to play it. They both love to add but neither one of them willing uses subtraction....until this game. It's exciting and fun to see with every roll of the dice if they will be adding or subtracting to see how many spaces they will move. The game also has some fun rock sections that have different challenges. We had a great time playing it and they really like picking their playing piece and want to change it with every game. The playing pieces are well made and have bright colors.
customer_reviews.author: Shop Lady

customer_reviews.title: Kids thought game was boring but maybe they were too young?
customer_reviews.text: I set up this game for my 6-year old grandsons who will be entering first grade at the end of the summer. They thought the game was boring and just wanted to play with the game pieces (which are cute and durable) and the board. They did not know what odd and even meant, so I guess I will try again later, when they are into first grade a little more. Board is colorful, with great graphics. The game seems like it could be played quickly if the child knows the basic math concepts. I would give the game 5 stars and the kids 3 stars because the were not ready.
customer_reviews.author: LegoFan

customer_reviews.title: custumer service amazing.
customer_reviews.text: The new version of this game has an error in the endless loop that extends the time you have to play. At first, I was frustrated with this but my son loves this game and it is a great game for learning simple addition and subtraction and making that fun. It also introduces odd and even numbers. So I guess... what's wrong with extending the game. I called and I was amazed with the customer service at Learning Resourses and will be buying more of their products. We've had it for 2 weeks now and my 6 year old son wants to play this game all day, everyday.
customer_reviews.author: A.Fusco

customer_reviews.title: Cool Game But Careful of Outgrowing It
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised, the game is engaging and exercises a kid's math ability. I think I just bought it too late because, once the novelty wore off, it quickly became too simple and repetitive for my child.
customer_reviews.author: XochiCompra

customer_reviews.title: Makes math fun! Cute & engaging!
customer_reviews.text: We eagerly opened up this game and played it as soon as it arrived. My 4 and 6 year old daughters loved it. My 6 year old, who needs math practice but gets easily distracted/bored while studying, didn't even realize she was putting the work in. She was just having fun. My 4 year old can't do the math yet but my 6 year old and I help her and tell her how many hops to take. I am hoping the early exposure will help her as well. Overall very happy with the purchase, the game is cute and engaging, and for the price, it gets an A plus from me. Can't speak to it's durability.
customer_reviews.author: Jess M.

customer_reviews.title: well-made, adorable, and fun!
customer_reviews.text: A board game that make learning basic addition & subtraction fun! Simple-to-learn game. The set is made up of a sturdy rectangular game board, 4 plastic game figures, and 3 dice (two green 6-sided number dice, and one white operation [ + / - ] die. To play the game, a player will roll the three dice; solve the addition or subraction equation; and the answer to the equation is the number of spaces the player moves. There are a few twists to the game (evens/odds, number spaces, a loop, and shortcut spaces). My 5y/o enjoys this game so much :) And, it gets two thumbs up from me and my husband!
customer_reviews.author: emleigha

customer_reviews.title: Excellent game and a new favorite
customer_reviews.text: We use it in our homeschool for math practice. I got it for my 8 year old but my 3.5 year old is having just as much fun. I've added some glass beads to count with and my toddler can play along easily. The game has some great dynamics for exciting game play. The pieces and game board are very well made. I highly recommend this game and will probably add it to my gifting list as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kim M.

customer_reviews.title: Great game for math - kindergarten
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4 year old son’s favorite game. He loves math and this is a way for him to practice equations in a fun way. When we play I pretend like I need help figuring out the problem, and he loves to solve them for me. We play with a set of (2 pairs of 10) block cubes for the bigger equations like 6+5 so that he can visually see how to get to that answer. I don’t want him reliant on finger counting so this really helps with mental math.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Engaging Game for Home or Classroom
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this game at home and in the classroom and it is always a winner. Kids of all ages love it and it reinforces basic math skills. Highly recommend this game for any caregiver or elementary teacher wanting to encourage kids to learn and practice addition and subtraction.
customer_reviews.author: Candi

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My boys 4 and 6 love this game! They both are able to do the math with some assistance. The 6 year old especially is beginning to learn and remember math facts which makes it perfect practice. We even tried using a 20 sided dice because my 6 year old wanted a challenge and it was still fun. The game is well made and fairly quick to play through. Some other reviewers complained about it being impossible to get out of the endless loop, but we have not had this problem. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lori A Dearborn

customer_reviews.title: Great learning game!
customer_reviews.text: After seeing some negative reviews I was hesitant to get this. But I really needed a fun way to get my younger child to practice basic math facts. I'm SO glad we got the game! We have not had any issues with the endless loop; so I'm assuming we have a corrected version. You can get stuck in it for a bit; but there are also multiple ways to get out. My kids have been playing together and we've played as a family. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Janaya

customer_reviews.title: Fun Math Game
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic math game and not terrible for the parent playing either! I’ve been buying games that I’d like to play too, sick of the Candylands of the world, and this one fits the bill. My four year old loves math and games, so this is perfect. We often skip all the space directions (odd/even, etc) and just do the equations to get our space counts to get to the end to make the game less tedious.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Super fun, simple game to help with addition and subtraction
customer_reviews.text: This was one of several simple math games I bought to help my kids learn math concepts when they were young. My daughter, not a big math fan, loved and continued to play this game for years beyond its useful life in helping her learn addition and subtraction. Game tokens are snail, snake, turtle, frog and these creatures make their way around the board, moving either forward or backwards depending one what comes up on the +/- die. The game can be played by very young kids and completed in about ten minutes. Sum Swamp is one of the simplest, most fun way to practice addition and subtraction in a game setting.
customer_reviews.author: JuLee Rudolf

customer_reviews.title: Great preschool math game!
customer_reviews.text: My 4.5 yr old LOVES this game. It surprised us with adding in great math (subtraction and addition) while also helping her learn even / odd numbers. You roll two number die then the 'action' die which tells you to either add or subtract. The resulting answer is how many spaces you move. There are a few special spaces with different instructions and you as the parent need to read the instructions to help the kids through those little areas. Easy! Once they learn they will LOVE it. Easy, fun, fast paced.
customer_reviews.author: Baker-Mom-Wife-Etc

customer_reviews.title: Great for semi beginners- will last years.
customer_reviews.text: We love this game! My four year old caught on fast. I see it lasting a while as he grows in math skills. Right now he counts on his fingers each time a person rolls (mom, dad & himself). As he grows, he may add & subtract using paper & pencil or count in his head. We will also add the additional obstacles (the even & odd spaces on the board). We started board games by playing Count The Chickens around 3yr. This is a great level 2. Should last from 4-7 years old.
customer_reviews.author: khitch

customer_reviews.title: Make Learning Fun!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game, rules are simple and straightforward, and the pieces all seem durable. There is an element of chance to it that makes it exciting for kids. My six year old has made marked progress on how quickly he can solve the problems and asks often to play. It’s been about a week and it is still his go to game, so I consider it money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Mika M.

customer_reviews.title: They don't even know they're learning!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect game to teach basic math skills to the toddlers/early school age children. But there's more -- this is a good game to use for speed for the older school children. It came with a sheet of rules that I thought could be confusing to the 4 and 5 year olds, so we just went straight on the spaces. The game lasts long enough that the littles aren't burnt out or bored with it. The additional rules (landing on a particular "even" or "odd" square) were better for the "big" kids. You can easily add extra rules to make it more difficult for them.
customer_reviews.author: JlS

customer_reviews.title: Good game for learning simple math! Can run a little long...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our 4 1/2 year old son; the addition and subtraction are easy enough to count on fingers. The game can run a little long for a little one's attention span, though. If you get caught in the "endless loop," the game can go from 15 minutes to over 20, easily. Love that the pieces are different than normal games, and the board is well illustrated. Overall, it's a fun AND educational game!
customer_reviews.author: andrkuc

customer_reviews.title: Great way to learn!
customer_reviews.text: My 4-year old loves this game and she has caught on to basic addition and subtraction so quickly! I love that it is usually a relatively quick game (~10 minutes) which is perfect for a 4yo attention span. While I don't think this game will stand the test of time, she will outgrow it, it has been a fun way to work on adding and subtracting as a family.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Education at its best!
customer_reviews.text: I am sooo pleased with this purchase! It continues to captivate my 6 yr old daughter’s attention every time. She keeps on saying “Mommy, I want to play The Swamp game”. Why? Because it introduces addition and subtraction facts in a non-fearful way. She thinks she is simply playing a game with the family and I see it as education in a non threatening way.
customer_reviews.author: M. l. Sangie

customer_reviews.title: Fun learning tool for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 4 year old to begin exploring addition and subtraction in a fun way. Absolutely blown away by how easy this game is to play and teach the basics. He adores the game and I enjoy playing with him too. It doesnt take too long and we usually play a few rounds before moving onto something else. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Proud Mama

customer_reviews.title: Good maths game.
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old son likes it . However you can only benefit from it for a short duration . They soon know addition and subtraction within 12 . Personally I , as an adult , find it boring .
customer_reviews.author: Kim C.

customer_reviews.title: Great game!!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old is working on her math and this game is making it fun. I highly recommend, actually, I already sent the link to my sister who also ended up buying this game for her 5 year old and she is loving it also. My 3 year old plays with us also and reads us the numbers while my 5 year old helps her add or subtract. Great game!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a 5 y/o and 3 y/o and it's a Hit! They love the game pieces and the board and right now the 5 y/o is doing all the math and loving it. The whole family is having fun with this game and it really teaches while having fun. I'll be looking for one that does different math or higher level math soon.
customer_reviews.author: BAG

customer_reviews.title: Better than skill and drill
customer_reviews.text: Great game for my 6 year old who has been struggling with math facts at school. She loves the animal game pieces, which are made of rubber and fit perfectly in her hands. The simple addition and subtraction is challenging but not so difficult she wants to quit. She brings me the game and asks to play, which is a big improvement. This is a stealth way to practice math without seeming to.
customer_reviews.author: Wilder Ranch

customer_reviews.title: Chomp Count Chomp
customer_reviews.text: My girls LOVE this game! They are ages 3 and 5. They especially love that one some spaces they can spin twice. I am sure that they don't even realize that the game is developing their math skills. Since only one person can win, this game is helping them develop the skill of being a good loser. They cheer for each other. Great fun. My husband and I do not mind playing this game with them.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred Levy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent board game for Kindergarteners
customer_reviews.text: This board game was recommended by parents in my local community and I’m glad I got it. My Kindergartener loves playing it, it was fairly easy to learn, and the math component is easy enough to be enjoyable to play but challenging enough for her to learn and practice what she needs to at her age. The player figurines are also super cute.
customer_reviews.author: Csilla Maroti

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fun and learning.
customer_reviews.text: I use this with my 5 year grandchildren and we have a blast!! They are learning the difference between larger and smaller numbers; odd and even numbers; addition and subtraction. I am a teacher and have not seen a better game for fun mathematical learning! The only thing I wish was added was a number line (which I made myself) to make the addition and subtraction a more visible learning experience. I love this game.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Playing this game with my 5.5yo to help prevent summer learning loss in a fun way. She enjoys it a lot, and it’s perfect for her age. I also find it rather fun, as it’s straight-forward and not too long (unless you get stuck in the loop, which doesn’t usually happen for any length of time). The box, board, and pieces are good quality as well.
customer_reviews.author: Beth M.

customer_reviews.title: Spans age groups - lasting fun!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 neighbor girls that come over to play most evenings. They are 5 and 8. This game has remained one of their favorites for over a year. They want to play it every time they come over. The best part is that it remains engaging for both girls, despite the age and skill difference.
customer_reviews.author: N. Neal

customer_reviews.title: Great math game for kindergarten level
customer_reviews.text: My 4.5 year old loves this game. We usually pull out some sort of math manipulative, small blocks or pennies, to help with math problems as he is still in the early learning stage. He doesn’t view this as school or work but 100% fun. I don’t mind playing it either which helps.
customer_reviews.author: Michael and Mary Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool
customer_reviews.text: We love this! Our son is 4 and he has a blast with this game, his math skills are growing and it’s enjoyable to play. Some reviews have mentioned the endless loop as a negative thing, we don’t find it to be an issue. At most it’ll be a great tool in patience for parents and kids alike. We enjoy it a lot and highly recommend !
customer_reviews.author: MEL

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I played this with my 5 and almost 9 yr old. It was fun and easy to figure out, the rounds went quick which is good for all of us. We brought it to a coffee house with some counter blocks to make it easier for my youngest. It was a great experience we plan to repeat weekly!
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: 5yr Old Nephew LOVES MATH & THIS GAME
customer_reviews.text: My 5yr old nephew absolutely LOVES MATH. He has always loved numbers ever since a young age. Wanting to keep him interested in math. I wanted a fun way for him to keep learning. Got this for his birthday. We played it weeks before his 5th birthday. He loved it. He is already super good at addition. But needs some work on his subtraction. This game is going to be a fun way for him to grasp the basics even better than he already does.
customer_reviews.author: Remialltheway

customer_reviews.title: Great Educational Game for the Whole Family
customer_reviews.text: Our 5 year old LOVES playing this game. During parent teach conference, our kindergarten teacher told us how much our son loved to play this game, so we bought one for home! This is a great game that works on addition, subtraction, even and odd numbers but is fun for the whole family to enjoy together! We loved it so much we bought another game for our daycare provider! Thank you so much Learning Resources for such a great game!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria C

customer_reviews.title: Great game for
customer_reviews.text: Bought this based on many good reviews for my 6 1/2 year old first grade grandson. What fun we’ve had! It’s quick to learn and we can play several rounds without boredom (for either of us!) The play pieces are lovely and the graphics of the game board are beautiful. This is my new go to gift for children (and their parents) in a wide range of ages from now on.
customer_reviews.author: alphamare of 6

customer_reviews.title: Cute game, but it's not worth $18. You ...
customer_reviews.text: Cute game, but it's not worth $18. You can basically play this without the board by adding or subtracting any die that you have at home. You could even use a different board game if you wanted!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Broussard

customer_reviews.title: Can’t recommend this game enough!!
customer_reviews.text: This was an instant hit in my house! My five year old loves games and this is one the whole family can have a little fun with! It’s great for him to practice simple addition and subtraction. Well made, easy to learn, and it doesn’t take very long to play. Will definitely be looking for other games by this maker.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica D'Onofrio

customer_reviews.title: The "loop" is the best part.
customer_reviews.text: Our whole family loves this game. I have a 9 year old and a soon to be 6 year old. They love this game, especially the "loop". They enjoy the challenge of the addition and subtraction. This is a great game for practicing beginning math operations.
customer_reviews.author: Mia J. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Fun and educational!
customer_reviews.text: Like all the other reviews have said- this does the trick!!! My five year old loves this game and is getting quicker with her calculations! This is a must. We've only had it for 2 days and have played about 8 times. Fun and educational my 2 favorite things!
customer_reviews.author: Loulou

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Basic Addition and Subtraction Game
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful game to work on basic addition and subtraction facts. It also teaches even and odd. Both my 5 and 7 yo love playing this game when we have game day at home school. Other reviewers have complained about "the endless loop". We have never had a problem being stuck there for too long. Our 3 player (there are pieces for 4 players) games usually wrap up in about 10 minutes. Both my children have benefited from practicing our math facts in this fun way.
customer_reviews.author: E. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great game for early math learners
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to bring into my daughter's kindergarten class. The rules are easy to pick up, and the game is an appropriate length for a classroom setting with limited time. Most of the kids enjoy it. A few get frustrated if they get stuck in the loop midway through the game. Simple enough for kids who are getting the basic math facts down. Entertaining enough to keep big brother interested too.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Spruance

customer_reviews.title: Great game for young math learners and the whole family
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game that we purchased for our 6-year old daughter who is learning her addition and subtraction. The game makes the process of addition and subtraction really fun (we have her calculate all of our moves), and she quickly seeks this game out as one that she wants to play. I'm seeing that she's picking up the 'intuitive calculations' where she doesn't have to think about the formula. We are also trying to swap in one regular dice (the dice included are actual numbers) in order to expand her the interchange of numbers and symbols. Definitely recommend this game
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth B. Korytkowski

customer_reviews.title: Excellent math game!
customer_reviews.text: I had to start homeschooling my kids this year, grades kindergarten and second. My second grader has always hated math. Thanks to this game (and a few I made myself) he actually gets it now and has a lot of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Sandi DiMarco

customer_reviews.title: Great game for 5 and up!
customer_reviews.text: Just played it twice with my 5 year old. My 9 year old joined in, too. Box is well built, too. I'll be having the 12 year old play this with younger kids. Can definitely see it improving everyone's addition and subtraction skills.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Learning Tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son last year for Christmas, he asks to play it several times a month. In Kindergarten, they just broke the ice in the math world. As he has continued to learn, he enjoys this game even more. We stick to the Addition and Subrtration and keep the rules simple. He is practicing and playing at the same time. Win/Win!
customer_reviews.author: Wowsa

customer_reviews.title: This "ones" a great "addition" to your collection
customer_reviews.text: We play this regularly for our homeschool - it's easy enough to catch on for littles. For ones new to adding and subtracting I just get out small opjects they can count - for us I use actual "counters" that I bought on Amazon - so if their die rolls 4 + 3 then we line up 4 counters the plus sign and then 3 counters and let them do it that way vs counting on their fingers. Helps that the little characters are rubbery so if you bump the board they don't just slide off and people lose their places! Box seems extra durable as well. Appreciate it all being so thoughtfully laid out.
customer_reviews.author: MomofFour

customer_reviews.title: Good learning game for preschool through 1st grade
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this game for our granddaughter who was 5 1/2 at the time and had just started kindergarten. We've played it quite often, and we've brought it with us to a play group. It is a very good game for learning to add and subtract. She is now about to start 1st grade, and I expect that she will still enjoy it during this school year, but I think by the time she enters 2nd grade she will find it to be boring. Therefore, I would recommend it for a 4 to 6 year old, but not older than that. I think the price is reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: GrandmaG

customer_reviews.title: FUN and learn some math too
customer_reviews.text: The game board, pieces and box are well made and excellent quality. The game is simple and fun. The rules and how to play are straight forward. It doesn’t take to long to play a game nor is it too fast. Best of all my 5 year old son not only loves to play it but this has brought out a love for basic math and numbers in him. As for the adults and older kids this game is still a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: BBN

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: My 5 and 8 year olds have had fun playing this together. The board and game pieces are very well made. The pieces are very cute and fun for the kids to play with. Teaches good basic math skills.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Hart

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Perfect game! Son started playing it at four and he still loves it almost two years later. Easy to play, but tricks them into adding. I ended up buying some 12 sided dice so we could practice up to 24 instead of just 12. Some days we skip math all together and just play this game.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Owner

customer_reviews.title: Would order again!
customer_reviews.text: This game is awesome! Perfect for my six year old learning math and addition. It's even kinda fun for me when I play with him!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Rose

customer_reviews.title: Not enough good things to say!
customer_reviews.text: In LOVE with this game!!! We have a four-year-old and she got this for Christmas. We have played it multiple times a week ever since (far more than any other board game). She likes the group play and competition to win and we like that it's actually teaching her math skills (addition, subtraction, evens/odds). It honestly isn't torturous at all to play which is much different than a lot of her other games. I would buy this for any pre-K to First grader looking to hone math skills.
customer_reviews.author: Ruthless Sprinkle

customer_reviews.title: What a wonderful game!
customer_reviews.text: Our son loves to learn using games so we've learned a lot about what makes a great game and what doesn't. A great game: . Sturdy in construction . Easy to set up. . Easy to understand instructions. . Capable of being modified as your child advances. . Teaches what is claims to teach. . Teaches without drudgery. This game scores 100% (got to get some math in there) on all counts. It is a simple, sturdy game which teaches kids through visualization (as the pieces move) and some competition. By purchasing a simple pair of dice with larger numbers, this game can be used to teach addition/subtraction with double digit numbers as well. A great deal!
customer_reviews.author: Nina Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Great board game!!!
customer_reviews.text: This game is fantastic for math concepts and is really fun to play. It has two dice, each with numbers up to six, with a third that has plus/minus... 4 yo kids are counting up to 12, adding, subtracting, etc. and enjoying it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Beez

customer_reviews.title: but it turns out this is a good stand-alone for my 6
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my kids as an add-on filler game, but it turns out this is a good stand-alone for my 6, 5, and 3-yo kids. My wife plays this even alone with my 3-yo. I was shocked that he is learning math at age 3!! My wife quizzes him now on some simple math (1 plus 1, 2 plus 1, 2 plus 2) and he's getting it right. Seriously shocked. Def glad I bought this. She suggests every kindergarten and 1st-grade teacher should have this in their classrooms.
customer_reviews.author: Ed from Powhatan, VA

customer_reviews.title: Family favorite - even for parents!
customer_reviews.text: Our family loves this game! Great for 6 1/2 year old and mom and dad also really enjoy it! 3 1/2 year old struggles as she can’t yet add or subtract on her own but as her number skills increase in the next year, I think it will also become one of her favorites!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great for a 4 year old
customer_reviews.text: Well, my 4 year old did lose interest in this, but not until after 4 weeks of adding! He would play it every day - LOVED it; his Dad and I took turns playing with him. Really engaging, I felt. The 2 year old liked to steal the pieces.
customer_reviews.author: TechnicalMongoose

customer_reviews.title: Great for practicing early addition; expandable
customer_reviews.text: It really helped my kids to get up to grade level in math. I expanded it by using 10-sided die and going around the board twice so they could practice higher addition.
customer_reviews.author: droth

customer_reviews.title: Great Family Game!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great family game. We play this game multiple times a week. We have a 5 year old and 3 year old. Our 5 year old has no problem playing on her own, while we help our 3 year old with his addition and subtraction sentences; he is still recognizing numbers and learning quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Familyof4

customer_reviews.title: Fun was to teach young ones math facts
customer_reviews.text: Our little ones love this game and it has really helped with math skills. The game can either go really fast or slow if you keep getting stuck in the circle. A good price for the game and the company shipped fast.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best suited for 1st and 2nd graders.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game about a year ago when my daughter was 5 (kindergartener). She didn't show much interest then. I put it away for several months. She recently turned 6 and started first grade. She loves this game, but she hates to lose game (any game) and she gets really upset when she loses. The game taught the concept of even and odd numbers that she didn't know before. My 2 year old enjoys moving the pieces while counting the numbers although he can't do addition or subtraction yet of course. This is a great game for 1-2 graders.
customer_reviews.author: Ai my me

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: I got this is an alternative way to do math instead of just doing worksheets for my son. He is happy with the game and it is a fun way to reinforce the skills he is learning.
customer_reviews.author: Lissy

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Cute
customer_reviews.text: A fun game to practice math. If anything, I would like a longer game board. The game ends pretty quickly most of the time. My husband didn’t read the directions so he didn’t understand the unending loop part. A strait forward line may be better. But it’s fun as is too
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Martin

customer_reviews.title: 5yo loves it! Fun, smart, engaging but BEWARE the Endless Loop! :)
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, fun, relatively easy to play with multi-ages (5yo daughter can play her herself, we help 3yo). Math made fun and set up a smart way (i.e., you can't get negative numbers). Usually a perfect length of time to play. Though beware the endless loop good idea in theory to have a way to slow down play, but it could actually be endless, we have come up with shortcuts if you pass the exit a certain number of times.
customer_reviews.author: Amy978

customer_reviews.title: Great Game
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old likes this game. It seems to be designed to be quick which is good for shorter for shorter attention spans. We like to substitute in our 12 sided dice for harder math equations. Even with that, it will be too easy for her next year. It is great practice for her now though to speed up her calculating.
customer_reviews.author: Dhreamy

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t be happier. My 5&7 year olds love playing this. They learn math while having fun! Cute colorful quality board, sturdy cute playing pieces. Short and sweet so it keeps them interested. Great purchase and a good gift!
customer_reviews.author: PNW Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great Game For Developing Early Math Skills
customer_reviews.text: We love this game! I recently bought a bunch of board games for my kinesthetic learner. She is not one to sit and be drilled - and while she is able to work sums with manipulatives, it quickly becomes "boring" for her. She loves the reptilian and amphibian game pieces, and the game is not only engaging enough, but also not overly long - a plus for busier children. Within a short amount of time, she was able to add and subtract "off the cuff," which is something she wasn't great with, previously. She still uses her fingers for some of the harder ones, but her math skills are coming along nicely, with the help of this fun game.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: FABULOUS Classroom Game
customer_reviews.text: I teach 1st and 2nd grade and my kids LOVE this game! It's a great way for them to practice fact fluency and they never get tired of it. The game has built-in differentiation in that the higher kids have an opportunity to share their strategies with the kids who need more practice. When I have slightly larger group, I just add my own fun counters but it would be nice if there were a couple more swampy pieces included.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jack

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best math game ever! My whole family loves it! For the little ones, it’s a true learning adventure. For the older kids and grownups, it’s a fun game of mathematical chance. A round lasts long enough to be satisfying, but not so long that the younger ones lose their patience. And it’s never the same game twice. Absolutely brilliant! This is a must-own game!
customer_reviews.author: kcole

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyable for the Whole Family
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew (6) for Christmas and my niece (9) wound up playing it for hours. So glad I bought this for them. Enjoyable for the whole family.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Sussman

customer_reviews.title: Fun Learning Game
customer_reviews.text: I bought Sum Swamp for my granddaughter after reading the reviews. She's a 1st grader and needs a little extra help with math...it was delivered yesterday and we played it again and again. She loved it...rules are easy to follow too. I highly recommend this game for kids and it's especially fun for Grammys and Poppys :)
customer_reviews.author: Anna G

customer_reviews.title: Sum Swamp is a hit!
customer_reviews.text: We gave this to my 4.5 year old for Christmas and he LOVES it. He is still learning the concept of adding and subtracting so we use a toy abacus. He now understands how to set up the equations and he even knows some answers off the top of his head. We usually play this game a couple times a week. It's a great way to teach addition and subtraction and kids don't even know they are learning!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great game-perfect for kindergarteners
customer_reviews.text: Perfect math game for our kindergarteners! We are a homeschooling family and love learning resources for ways to help bring a fun element to our routine!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made our math easy!
customer_reviews.text: My 5& 3 year old beg to play this game. They are adding and subtracting and learning about odd and even numbers without thinking about it. Math was a subject that made us ALL wanna pull our hair out. Not now! Buy this game!
customer_reviews.author: Diana Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: My 5 & 6 year old girls liked this pretty well
customer_reviews.text: My 5 & 6 year old girls liked this pretty well! It's a cute game and moves really fast. After about three quick rounds they were ready to move on to something else but I think its a worthwhile purchase just for the quick math review it provides. Easy to understand and such a wonderful opportunity to learn while you play. My girls say this is second place to Monolpy Jr. which is their current favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Learning can be so much fun
customer_reviews.text: This is a game we play over and over. Learning math, persistence, taking turns and having fun all at the same time. We have recommended this already to friends several times.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Mansfield

customer_reviews.title: Educational but really fun.
customer_reviews.text: My grandchildren love to play this. They are 4 to 7. I saw their skills improve while they were just having fun. The 4 year old used her fingers to add and subtract but was able to do it in her own. We play this over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great game!!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this game! I use it in place of math lessons some days to help my son master some addition and subtraction facts! The board is think and the pieces are a type of silicone material. I just wish the board was longer with even more practice!
customer_reviews.author: Prime Member

customer_reviews.title: This game was highly recommended by a mom friend of mine for my Kinder ...
customer_reviews.text: This game was highly recommended by a mom friend of mine for my Kinder student, but it wasn't as challenging for him as I'd hoped it would be. I have two 3-year-olds that I think it will be better suited for once they start preschool. I am glad I got it on a Christmas sale.
customer_reviews.author: Dayzdays

customer_reviews.title: A homeschool win!
customer_reviews.text: My kids were so excited to play this game, and they were not not disappointed. The play time is reasonable and fun. The board is sturdy but it is too soon to speak of long term durability. The little player pieces are solid plastic, cute and fun for the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Julia C

customer_reviews.title: Best Math Game for Young Learners!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my four year old son who is working on math facts at his Montessori Pre-school and this is the game he chooses to play at home at least once a day! We all love it! I also recently used it with my first grade resource math group and they LOVED it so much that all the first grade teachers in the school ordered it for their classrooms. It isn't just about math facts, it teaches odds and evens, one to one correspondence, operation distinction, and turn taking. I wish I could find an equally exciting, fun and educational game that works on language skills!
customer_reviews.author: Peanut's mom

customer_reviews.title: Very good for math practice
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this game, we just wish it was a little longer. I play this with my 4 year old, 7 year old, and my 8 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Well made game. My 5 yo isn’t this advanced but we play it modified. We’ll get there. No formal Learning until 7 necessary!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M

customer_reviews.title: Great game to practice Math
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this game. They even ask me to play it every day. I'm so happy because they are learning math, even and odd numbers while they are having fun. Totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: janeth herrera

customer_reviews.title: Fun (and educational)!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this game. So simple and the kids love it. My son said he does not consider this a "math" game because it's as fun as a regular game.
customer_reviews.author: Homeschool Mom

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: We love this game! It has simple rules and throws in a little curve ball every once kn a while to keep it interesting
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Spivey

customer_reviews.title: too easy, limited numbers to use
customer_reviews.text: The game is based on rolling two dices. Basically, kids can only practice addition/subtraction using only 6 numbers (1-6). 6+6 That is the largest number they can get. The game is easy to play so I would suggest it for younger ones like 4 year old kids although it is labeled as 5 above.
customer_reviews.author: KZ

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for K, 1st, 2nd grade
customer_reviews.text: Great math game for kids learning to add and subtract. Bought it for my daughter, in 1st grade, and then for her friend, in Kindergarten, who loved playing it at our house. The whole family can play. Not as long and boring as Chutes and Ladders. You roll the dice and add the total to see how far you move. It also has spots you land on requiring you to roll an odd or even number so the girls learned about those as well.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: This game is great! My 5 year old was having a difficult ...
customer_reviews.text: This game is great! My 5 year old was having a difficult time doing math in hear head. She loves playing this game and her addition and subtraction skills have improved immensely. We have only had the game anout a week.
customer_reviews.author: haythatsnotfunny

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it! Me too!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best game that could ever be made to make addition/subtraction fun for toddlers. The game involves throwing 3 dices to make move. Two dices have numbers on them, where as the third dice is the +,- operator. The child has to add or subtract numbers to make the right move. The game also teaches even/odd numbers. The endless loop in the game is hilarious. We always keep laughing on when can we get out of going around ducks! My son (4.5 years) loves the game, and we have noticed that he can now do maths mentally as well, without drawing lines on paper. Recommend whole-heartedly.
customer_reviews.author: smrsxn

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game!
customer_reviews.text: Our son LOVES this game!! It is helping to build his confidence in math!
customer_reviews.author: ckmommy

customer_reviews.title: Kids enjoy it
customer_reviews.text: My kids hate worksheets but very willingly play this game with me. They are picking up adding and subtracting pretty quickly and with smiles on their faces. They love the fun game pieces too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: super fun, and good quality!
customer_reviews.text: Really nice game board and pieces. The concept I thought would be a little difficult but my 9 year old has taken to it so much she is teaching her 5 and 3 year old siblings to play! The only thing is there is a "loop" that you have to roll the exact right combo to get out of and the little ones have a hard time with patience, but I totally recommend this game! It is really a lot of fun to play!
customer_reviews.author: jason

product_meta.title: Learning Resources Sum Swamp Game, Homeschool, Addition/Subtraction, Early Math Skills, Math Games for Kids, Educational Board Games, 8 Pieces, Ages 5+
product_meta.description:
Color:Multi-colorEncourage math drills through fun game play with Sum Swamp. Journey through the swamp by adding and subtracting numbers on the dice. Includes gameboard, 4 swamp creature game pieces, 2 number dice, and an operations dice.

AMAZON.COM
Kids will have a terrific time learning math skills as they avoid the hilarious pitfalls of the Sum Swamp. Designed for two to four players, this game is sure to develop and sharpen beginning math skills, because the only way to escape the mire is to roll the dice and add and subtract your way around the board. If you're lucky, you'll be able to take the Crocodile Short Cut, although sooner or later everyone gets caught in the Endless Loop. Landing on special squares, such as Even or Odds or a number space, makes things even more interesting; you could get stuck for quite a while. The best part is that this is a game kids can grow with--children 5 to 6 will find it a learning challenge, and older kids can play for fun. The game is an Oppenheim Best Toy award winner. --Marianne Painter

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Venture over the crocodile shortcut and through the swamp to the finish by adding and subtracting numbers on the dice. Includes game board, 4 swamp creature game pieces, 2 number dice and an operation die. For 2-4 players. Board measures 17"L x 12"H. Grades PreK+.

See more
feature_bullets: ENCOURAGE LEARNING: Encourage basic math drills through fun game play with Sum Swamp
DEVELOP MATH SKILLS: Develop fluency in early math skills as kids play the game. Perfect for Homeschool or classroom learning!
IMMERSIVE PLAY: Race through the swamp while facing math challenges and meeting funny swamp creatures along the way
EVERYTHING YOU NEED: Includes gameboard, 4 swamp creature game pieces, 2 number dice, and an operation die
GAMES FOR CLASS & HOME LEARNING: Homeschool supplies for ages 5+, For 2-4 players
